author: jdhitsolutions
body:
Before the latest beta I was able to install and run the PowerShell 6 alphas in the Bash shell on Windows 10. Now, with the beta install, the shell hangs when I try to start PowerShell.  I realize I could post an issue on GitHub but thought I'd check with the group first.

I am running Windows 10 build 16193.
In the Bash shell, which I just upgraded as well, I can see that PowerShell beta is installed.
```
powershell/xenial,now 6.0.0-beta.1-1ubuntu1.16.04.1 amd64 [installed]
```
lsb_release -a shows:
```
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS
Release:        16.04
Codename:       xenial
```
I've even tried running powershell -noprofile with no change.

Ideas or suggestions for things to look at? 

I see a similar comment at the end of #3747
